channel.title: Comments on: Book Review: Your Code as a Crime Scene

item.title: By: Victor
item.dc:creator: Victor
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../index.html#comment-49">Adam Tornhill</a>.
Thanks for sharing the link! Really interesting to see how you approached analyzing a code base of that scale. I've just finished reading the Software (r)Evolution article series and they are a great addition to the book!

item.title: By: Adam Tornhill
item.dc:creator: Adam Tornhill
item.description: Thanks for the review - interesting to get your perspective on the book. The analyses have evolved since I wrote the book. I do have more examples on how the techniques help improve large codebases. For example this case study on Analyzing Patterns in the Evolution of Linux: http://www.empear.com/blog/software-revolution-part4/
